abstracts.cdata!:
Impressive ratings convey a highly
            satisfactory project outcome, highly likely sustainability,
            and high institutional development impacts, achieved through
            a highly satisfactory Borrower performance, and satisfactory
            performance by the Bank. As a learning and innovation loan,
            the Project contributed to the enrichment of Mexico's
            gender work. The project developed methodological elements
            that were very useful in the discussions on how to
            mainstream gender equity into public policies in the region;
            the two models tested developed a set of instruments,
            manuals, methods, and processing that can be easily adapted
            and replicated in other countries. The CONVIVE Model showed
            that incorporating a gender approach can enhance the quality
            and results of CDD interventions, therefore increasing
            investment payoffs. The GEM demonstrated that the private
            sector is willing to incorporate a gender equity approach as
            a means of corporate responsibility that also has positive
            results within the firms' labor environment. These two
            results indicate that there is an opportunity for the Bank
            to promote self-standing gender equity projects within
            communities and the private sector with the main objective
            of creating a new approach, and the behavioral changes
            required to address gender bias for the establishment of a
            more inclusive development model. Further lessons highlight
            the design of tools and techniques are critical factors to
            mainstream gender; technical assistance that is
            collaborative, participatory, continuous, and covers the
            entire women groups' capacity building process, proved
            effective in strengthening both women's organizations,
            and their productive projects; gender awareness training,
            combined with leadership training, allows women and men to
            address power issues entailed in gender disparities; and,
            partnerships with the private sector to mainstream gender
            equity are feasible, provided firms have options to
            participate and lead the process of change, and receive
            permanent advice to implement the model from the Project staff.
